page.title: 02LANDSCAPE OF TODDINGTON
page.content: The rural{landscape}of this area is dominated by the Toddington Manor Farms. This is arable land with woods, lakes and Manor grounds. The most up- to-date farming methods and machinery are used. In contrast, there is a collection of vintage farm machinery and some rare breeds of sheep,cattle and goats. Recently the {Manor}itself has been renovated and the grounds restored to their former beauty. There is even a cricket pitch there. An interesting feature of Toddington is Conger Hill which is possibly the remains of a motte and bailey{castle}. According to legend a witch can be heard frying pancakes beneath the hill on Shrove Tuesday. Another feature of Toddington is the { {village pond}which was incorporated into a Memorial Garden after the Second World War.
